page.title: 05CHANGING TIMES
page.content: {... Changing Times.. I can remember back 60 yrs,when I was 5 yrs old.There were no buses so all the villagers went once a week to War- wick on Gregory's carrier.This was a green van with steps at the back and wooden sides,& as the roads were very bad every bump could be felt!It cost 6d.return.There were two old ladies who were so afraid of this contraption that they pushed their four-wheeled truck the 4miles into Warwick and back for their shopping.My father was a farmer at White House Farm,my mother opened the first village shop there, which did a roaring trade before the buses came through.She sold everything from underwear to petrol.She made faggots & sold them hot.We used to have a delivery of bread from Warwick in a pony & trap with lights on late at night.At Easter time we all took
